refnamediv.refname: RFC CDK #20: Removal of get/setRemark and get/setPhysicalProperty from ChemObject

refsect1.title: Proposal
refsect1.para: To remove the get/setRemark() and get/setPhysicalProperty() methods from the ChemObject class.

refsect1.title: Reason
refsect1.para: First, they are not used in the CDK library itself, and only make the ChemObject larger. Secondly, their use is easily replace by the more general get/setProperty(), as remarks and physical properties are instances of the general idea property.

Optionally, one can circumvent collisions with others in two ways: If you use a String as a property identifier, as is done often in the CDK library, you could use a namespace to prefix the property identifier. This approach is followed by the current cdk.dict package. Secondly, one could use a subclass of String, or any class, and use that class as a property identifier; this is possible, because the ChemObject.setProperty() method takes an Object as identifier, and not just String objects.
